channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16682] Fix Shell tests failure. NoClassDefFoundError for MiniKdc

item.summary: Fix Shell tests failure. NoClassDefFoundError for MiniKdc

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Most probably caused by HBASE-14734, though i have no idea how.
I was scratching my head about how it got in through pre-submit, only to realize later that tests failures reported by QA may not give complete picture, since failure makes maven stop in middle.

Uploading the patch which fixed it on my end.
Sean Busbey ptal. I presumed it was something with deps, so made this blind change which actually fixed it. Please confirm if this makes sense.
Appy I work on HBASE-16666 and found this problem, too. I upload a v1 patch to fix it and the hadoop qa shows green result.

-1 overall



Vote Subsystem Runtime Comment

+1 hbaseanti 0m 0s Patch does not have any anti-patterns.
+1 @author 0m 0s The patch does not contain any @author tags.

(edited)
Guanghao Zhang, i thought about it and realized later that the right fix would actually be adding the deps in -hbase-common-.
I have been playing with pom for last 30 min. But can't seem to figure it out. The right fix is adding minikdc deps in hbase-testing-util, but that's not fixing it.

-1 overall

Test Results https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3671/testReport/
modules C: hbase-common U: hbase-common
Console output https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3671/console
Powered by Apache Yetus 0.3.0 http://yetus.apache.org

This message was automatically generated.

After HBASE-14734, HBaseTestingUtility use MiniKdc class and it is used in hbase-rsgroup and hbase-thrift package, too. But the unit tests in hbase-rsgroup and hbase-thrift didn't have this problem. So it is not a common problem and maybe we can only fix it in hbase-shell pom?

It bother me not knowing why such a thing is happening. I spent 45 min trying to get it working by playing with deps in hbase-testing-util, but i still don't understand why hbase-shell isn't getting it transitively.
So am fine with adding it to hbase-shell/pom for now to fix the broken tests.
This change is probably better here because it's linked with HBASE-14734, then in HBASE-16666 which has to do with replication.
Please +1 the v1 patch (QA failure was because of unmodified tests).

Agreed. I will update HBASE-16666 after this be committed. v1 patch looks good to me except the version info. The version will extend from parent pom and it doesn't need to set. I am +1 for this. But it should need a +1 from committer?

hadoop dependencies need to be within one hadoop version-specific profiles (and usually require updating both the hadoop 2 and hadoop 3 profiles, though I don't know if our hadoop 3 profile is actually currently usable)
also if the shell, rsgroup, and thrift modules all make use of the minikdc, then those modules should each list the dependency. common should only list it if common itself makes use of it.

That's the thing, none of those 3 modules (shell, rsgroup, thrift) actually use minikdc.
It's just shell complaining, probably because of some jruby stuff (see the stack trace).
Scratch the common module part, i mentioned it by mistake.
Sean Busbey I don't want to spend hours to dig into jruby to find the reason for this, mainly because i have a feeling that it'll be of no use and we'll still end up doing the fix of add deps in hbase-shell/pom.
What do you say?
v3 patch adds the deps to hadoop profiles.

-1 overall

+1 on this to fix the build.

Committed to master.
Running TestShell on branch-1 without patch, i don't see this issue, so didn't backport.
However i see different and most probably unrelated failure:
